intro: Triphora debilis, commonly known as the weak triphora, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its soft, hairy stems and showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Triphora debilis is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive foliage and delicate floral display.
